summary: Collects Illumina Basecalling metrics for a sequencing run.

arguments.summary: The barcodes directory with _barcode.txt files (generated by ExtractIlluminaBarcodes). If not set, use BASECALLS_DIR.
arguments.name: --BARCODES_DIR

arguments.summary: The Illumina basecalls output directory from which data are read
arguments.name: --BASECALLS_DIR

arguments.summary: Compression level for all compressed files created (e.g. BAM and VCF).
arguments.name: --COMPRESSION_LEVEL

arguments.summary: Whether to create a BAM index when writing a coordinate-sorted BAM file.
arguments.name: --CREATE_INDEX

arguments.summary: Whether to create an MD5 digest for any BAM or FASTQ files created.
arguments.name: --CREATE_MD5_FILE

arguments.summary: Google Genomics API client_secrets.json file path.
arguments.name: --GA4GH_CLIENT_SECRETS

arguments.summary: The file containing barcodes to expect from the run - barcodeData.#
arguments.name: --INPUT

arguments.summary: The lane whose data will be read
arguments.name: --LANE

arguments.summary: When writing files that need to be sorted, this will specify the number of records stored in RAM before spilling to disk. Increasing this number reduces the number of file handles needed to sort the file, and increases the amount of RAM needed.
arguments.name: --MAX_RECORDS_IN_RAM

arguments.summary: The file to which the collected metrics are written
arguments.name: --OUTPUT

arguments.summary: Whether to suppress job-summary info on System.err.
arguments.name: --QUIET

arguments.summary:
A description of the logical structure of clusters in an Illumina Run, i.e. a description of the structure IlluminaBasecallsToSam assumes the  data to be in. It should consist of integer/character pairs describing the number of cycles and the type of those cycles (B for Sample Barcode, M for molecular barcode, T for Template, and S for skip).  E.g. If the input data consists of 80 base clusters and we provide a read structure of "28T8M8B8S28T" then the sequence may be split up into four reads:
* read one with 28 cycles (bases) of template
* read two with 8 cycles (bases) of molecular barcode (ex. unique molecular barcode)
* read three with 8 cycles (bases) of sample barcode
* 8 cycles (bases) skipped.
* read four with 28 cycles (bases) of template
The skipped cycles would NOT be included in an output SAM/BAM file or in read groups therein.
arguments.name: --READ_STRUCTURE

arguments.summary: One or more directories with space available to be used by this program for temporary storage of working files
arguments.name: --TMP_DIR

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Deflater instead of the Intel Deflater for writing compressed output
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_DEFLATER

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Inflater instead of the Intel Inflater for reading compressed input
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_INFLATER

arguments.summary: Validation stringency for all SAM files read by this program.  Setting stringency to SILENT can improve performance when processing a BAM file in which variable-length data (read, qualities, tags) do not otherwise need to be decoded.
arguments.name: --VALIDATION_STRINGENCY

description:
A Command line tool to collect Illumina Basecalling metrics for a sequencing run Requires a Lane and an input file of Barcodes to expect. Outputs metrics:
  • Mean Clusters Per Tile
  • Standard Deviation of Clusters Per Tile
  • Mean Pf Clusters Per Tile
  • Standard Deviation of Pf Clusters Per Tile
  • Mean Percentage of Pf Clusters Per Tile
  • Standard Deviation of Percentage of Pf Clusters Per Tile
name: CollectIlluminaBasecallingMetrics
